paragraphs.text:
I am going to swallow all the words in the world
And I am not giving them back
Until we stop buying condos and
Learn to sing our stories 
Until we learn to speak in opening eyelids and sighs
Until the etymology of our movement is as significant our loan contracts 
Until we stop associating the color white
With cleanliness.

7b7fa7fffd5b.title: While I’m no anarchist, I have to say this was one of the most engaging poems I’ve read in a while.

paragraphs.name: 4f23
paragraphs.text: While I’m no anarchist, I have to say this was one of the most engaging poems I’ve read in a while. The imagery is so playful and vivid and imaginative. Your wordplay is inspiring. :) Thanks for sharing!

paragraphs.name: 1b39
paragraphs.text: A really great read! I love the imagery, very surreal, reminds me of magical realism. One question though, and I may have read this wrong, but you mention how there are worse fates than dying in water, but from the last line “Just the tsunami and you/And whether you will swim or not” to me, implies that after all is said and done after the divides…

virtuals.subtitle:
What I am going to do
Is 
Drink Lake Michigan
I am going to kneel at the shore with cupped hands 
Until the whole thing is in my belly…

paragraphs.name: d7db
paragraphs.text: The Tsunami And You

What I am going to do
Is 
Drink Lake Michigan
I am going to kneel at the shore with cupped hands 
Until the whole thing is in my belly
Right down to the
Shipwreck skeletons 
And I am going to refuse to put it back
Until the
Lake Michigan Monster serves me tea 
And grants me 34 wishes, one for…

Wow Nina ! I thought I had seen the farthest modern possibilities of poetry. You’ve brought modern poetry to another level !
